intro: Cheilanthes rudis, commonly known as the rock fern or stone fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and is typically found growing on rocky substrates. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, with short, thick rhizomes that help anchor it to its habitat. Its fronds are usually leathery and have a distinctive, often serrated margin. Cheilanthes rudis is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient and hardy plant.
